column2: MARYLAND DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: Maryland
column6: MD

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column6: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

column2: 2. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column6: turn off the ignition.
column8: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 3. When entering an expressway from the entrance ramp, you should:
column4: use the acceleration lane to blend into the traffic.
column6: go down to the bottom of the ramp and stop until it is safe to enter the expressway.
column8: cross over to the traffic lane as soon as possible.

column2: 4. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 5. A defensive driver:
column4: knows when it is safe to pass other vehicles.
column6: never drives below the speed limit.
column8: considers what other drivers might do and is always prepared to act.

column2: 6. The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
column4: let them pass if it's safe to do so.
column6: always keep your eyes focused ahead of your car.
column8: flash your brake lights.

column2: 7. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop.
column6: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 8. To reduce road rage, you should:
column4: use your horn frequently to warn other drivers.
column6: always signal your intention when changing lanes.
column8: talk on your cell phone while driving.

column2: 9. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: after it has been raining for an hour or more.
column6: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.
column8: the first rain after a dry spell.

column2: 10. Drivers should change lanes:
column4: as quickly as possible.
column6: gradually and carefully.
column8: often.

column2: 11. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column4: Vertical rectangle
column6: Round
column8: Pentagon

column2: 12. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a one lane bridge ahead.
column6: the right lane ends.
column8: the road ahead is narrow.

column2: 13. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: go back and wait the “WALK” light
column6: stop immediately.
column8: finish crossing the street.

column2: 14. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait for the next green light.
column6: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column8: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: There is a detour ahead
column6: The highway ahead is being repaired
column8: Crossroads ahead

column2: 16. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column6: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 17. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column8: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: Stop
column6: Yield the right-of-way
column8: Traffic signal ahead

column2: 19. This sign means:
column4: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
column6: Vehicles may only turn left.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns.

column2: 20. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Make eye contact.
column6: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column8: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 21. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column8: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.

column2: 22. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its left lane.
column6: must turn into its right lane.
column8: can not turn left.

column2: 23. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: NO TURN ON RED.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 24. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column6: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column8: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.

column2: 25. When coming up behind a vehicle stopped at a crosswalk, you:
column4: may not pass that vehicle.
column6: may pass the vehicle on the right with extreme caution.
column8: should go around the vehicle if safe.
